item.title: Beogram 4002 DC Platter Motor: Some Microsurgery on Disconnected Pickup Coils
item.description: I recently obtained a DC platter motor from a Beogram 4002 located in Norway. The motor required repair. The owner had already performed the ‘oil infusion’ procedure for the Oilite bearings. However, after reassembling and reinstalling the motor into the Beogram, the platter’s speed was excessively high and could not be adjusted. This image displays the motor, without the pulley, in the condition I received it: Uncontrollably high speed in a DC platter motor usually indicates a problem with one or both of the RPM feedback pickup coils within the motor, assuming the motor control circuit is functioning correctly.
